column4: I can't ping myself from other computers on the network.  Any Ideas?
Well, I'm connected to a router, and the other 2 computers are connected to the same router with the same subnet/gateway.   Is that what you mean ?
how do I add network connectivity?
Does it say you are connected?  By default the network monitor applet is on the top panel in ubuntu, and it will say if you're connected.
Yes I'm connected via DHCP.  my ip is 192.168.1.107 and I am trying to ping that from my other computers which are also 192.168.1.xxx    I assume I'm connected, as I'm on the internet right now.
I can ping google.com and I can ping my router, 192.168.1.1   and I can even ping the other computers.   But the other computers can't ping me
it's possible that your computer is blocking icmp (ping requests).
I'd have to do some searching to figure out how to fix that
I have port 21 forwarded, and a ftp server installed (proftpd) and I cant ping port 21 either
So you're trying to access an ftp share on this computer from the other two?  I haven't had any problems doing that on Hardy
have ports forwarded, and still get connection refused.   do i need to open ports in iptables, I thought the daemon would do that for me?
but since icmp isnt even working, it seems like all I have is WAN not LAN
I don't know, I've only done it between computers that were on the same subnet through DHCP without port forwarding.
Ok thanks, I'm starting to think it's the Windows computers that are at fault   =]
